title: General
fullText:
With respect to AS/NZS 3000, the connection of an installation to a stand-alone power system may be considered equivalent to the connection of an installation to a distribution network where control and protection systems are integral to the stand-alone power system.
Typical layouts and connections with main switchboards are shown in Figures 4.2 to 4.4.
NOTES:
1 30 mA type A RCBO provides earth leakage, overload and overcurrent protection for the load.
2 Neutral connection of stand-alone power supply to be earthed to allow RCBO to operate on earth leakage load.
3 RCBO can be replaced by RCCB and a MCB.
4 Use of a Type A RCD may be necessary due to high d.c. component in the inverter waveform or inverter manufacturer's recommendation. In New Zealand, the use of a Type A RCD is mandated.
